# What is Adobe Story CC Plus and How to Use It?
 
Adobe Story CC Plus is a cloud-based service that helps you with screenwriting and production planning. It is part of the Adobe Creative Cloud suite of applications, which means you can access it from any device with an internet connection. You can also collaborate with other writers and filmmakers on your projects, and export your scripts to various formats.

In this article, we will show you how to get started with Adobe Story CC Plus, and what features it offers to help you create your next great story.
 
## How to Set Up a New Project in Adobe Story CC Plus
 
To create a new project in Adobe Story CC Plus, you need to sign in to your Creative Cloud account and go to [https://story.adobe.com](https://story.adobe.com). You will see a dashboard where you can manage your projects, scripts, schedules, reports, and settings.
 
To start a new project, click on the "+" icon at the top left corner of the dashboard. You will be asked to choose a project type: Film & TV Script, AV Script, or Documentary Script. Each type has a different template and formatting options. You can also choose a language for your project.
 
After selecting a project type, you will be taken to the script editor, where you can write your screenplay. You can use the toolbar at the top to change the font size, style, alignment, and color of your text. You can also use keyboard shortcuts to switch between different elements, such as scene heading, action, character, dialogue, parenthetical, transition, shot, etc.
 
You can also add notes, comments, tags, metadata, and images to your script. These will help you organize your story and provide additional information for production planning.
 
## How to Use the Adobe Story CC Plus Interface
 
The Adobe Story CC Plus interface consists of four main areas: the menu bar, the toolbar, the script editor, and the sidebar.
 
- The menu bar contains options for file management, editing, view, tools, window, and help. You can use it to create, open, save, print, export, import, undo, redo, cut, copy, paste, find and replace, spell check, zoom in and out, switch between projects and scripts, access online help and tutorials, etc.
- The toolbar contains buttons for formatting your text and adding elements to your script. You can use it to change the font size, style, alignment, and color of your text. You can also use it to insert scene numbers, page breaks, notes, comments, tags, metadata, images,
etc.- The script editor is where you write your screenplay. It shows the formatted text of your script according to the project type you selected. You can use keyboard shortcuts or the toolbar buttons to switch between different elements. You can also use the mouse to select text and drag and drop it to rearrange it.
- The sidebar contains tabs for accessing different features of Adobe Story CC Plus. You can use it to view your project outline,
